result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Masheia S Wadlington in court. Attorney John A Best in court for Masheia S Wadlington. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. NGI report is on file and has been reviewed by counsel and defendant; all stipulate to findings in the report. Counsel are still negotiating resolution as to length of commitment, credit and conditional release. Anticipate filing plea form. Court finds defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. Matter adjourned for G/NG phase. Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Masheia S Wadlington in court, in custody.  Attorney John A Best in court for Masheia S Wadlington.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Competency report is on file and has been reviewed by counsel; all stipulate to the report. Court finds def is competent to proceed. NG and NGI pleas entered. Court orders NGI exam be condcuted by Dr Craig Schoenecker. Case to tag with 22CF307 at this time; knowing additional time may be needed for completion of NGI report. September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Masheia S Wadlington not in court.  Attorney John A Best in court for Masheia S Wadlington.  (22CF307; 22CM525; 22CM593; 22CM600-Br. 2; 22ME99)  Defendant is in a psychiatric hospital.  There is a final hearing on 7-19-2022.  Atty. Best states the WFU is aware of where the defendant is now and had a telephone conversation with the defendant yesterday.  State and Atty. Best request to have case called in Branch 2 on results of competency evaluation due to Branch 2 having felony case.  Court requests to have case called in Branch 2 and if needed case to be brought back to Branch 1.  Atty. Best was recently appointed on additional cases by SPD.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Masheia S Wadlington in court.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Masheia S Wadlington.  Prior to court being called defendant made inappropriate comments.  Defendant makes comments before case even called about right to carry arms and being harassed by police officers.  Defendant starts screaming in court is being evicted and slamming hands on table.  Atty. Van Dam requests a competency evaluation.  Court orders a competency evaluation.  Court admonishes the defendant after defendant threw the courtroom desk blotter toward defense counsel.
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Masheia S Wadlington in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco as a friend of the in court for Masheia S Wadlington. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender as receives social security disability and has a part-time job.  Not guilty plea entered.  State requests small amount of cash bond if defendant does not have a residence.  Atty. de Junco requests a signature bond.  Court orders $250.00 cash bond.  Court appoints Atty Becky Van Dam.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate to be determined.
Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
